channel.title: Evan Welch Data Science Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content on Evan Welch Data Science Portfolio

item.title: Titanic Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description:
Compared various variables to survival outcome for passengers aboard the Titanic by creating graphics in R.

Through this project, I learned about creating graphics using R (tidyverse) for EDA.

  • dataset

item.title: Harford Chapter OA Website
item.description:
Created a basic website to assist my Order of the Arrow (OA) Chapter.

Through this project, I learned about HTML and CSS, and gained exposure to Javascript for web dev.

  • website
  • github repository

item.title: Eagle Scout Project
item.description:
Created a 3 bin compost system for the Harford Glen Environmental Education Center.

Through this project, I learned about having effective organization, communication, and leadership skills, as well as budgeting, logistics, construction, and CAD modeling.

  • facebook post

item.title: Comparing Greenhouse Emission Levels by State
item.description:
Utilizing data from the EPA website the compare CO2, NOx, and CH4 emissions by state.

Through this project, I learned about using Tableau to manipulate data and use it to create powerful interactive graphs.

  • view in tableau public
  • dataset
  • source

item.title: Excel GME Dashboard
item.description:
Used stock data from yahoo finance to analyze the Gamestop stock.

Through this project, I learned about creating powerful graphics and forecasts in Excel.

item.title: Excel Housing Dashboard
item.description:
Used data from this dataset on Kaggle to analyze California housing prices.

Through this project I learned about finding summary statistics from data and creating map based 3d graphics using coordinates.

item.title: Code.org Js Games
item.description:
Created games in code.org Javascript from middle school up until freshman year. Linked below is a website with most of them. Two of them are embedded and can be viewed by clicking the project tile.

Through this project I learned about using Javascript for basic game development.

  • website

This will outline the creation of a Thompson Sampling algorithm

  • Scenario: We have option a with an unknown p = 0.8 and option b with an unknown p = 0.3
  • We will start with two uniform density beta distributions, and declare the number of iterations
a_alpha <- 1

a_beta <- 1

b_alpha <- 1

b_beta <- 1

i <- 100 #number of times the trial is run

Then we can create a function to model Thompson Sampling
